title: Claude Opus 4.5 Release
description: Anthropic announced Claude Opus 4.5 with significant improvements to coding performance, scoring 80% on SWE-Bench Verified benchmark and introducing new Claude Code desktop application

title: Claude Opus 4.5 Reclaims Coding Crown
description: Claude Opus 4.5 beats OpenAI and Google in coding competitions, demonstrating superior performance in software engineering tasks

title: New Desktop Application
description: Anthropic rolls out Claude Code desktop app as part of the Opus 4.5 launch, expanding access beyond web interfaces

title: $2.3B Series D Funding Round
description: Cursor AI secures $2.3 billion Series D funding at $29.3 billion valuation, with major backing from Nvidia and Google

title: Cursor Founders Become Billionaires
description: Cursor's founders reach billionaire status following the massive Series D funding round, highlighting the company's rapid growth and market impact

title: Auto Model Selection Public Preview
description: GitHub introduces auto model selection for Copilot in Visual Studio, automatically choosing the best AI model for coding tasks

title: Copilot CLI Enhanced Features
description: GitHub Copilot CLI receives new models, enhanced code search capabilities, and improved image support for developers

title: Plan Mode in Public Preview
description: GitHub Copilot's plan mode now available in public preview for JetBrains, Eclipse, and Xcode, enabling better development planning

title: Visual Studio 2026 Integration
description: Microsoft releases Visual Studio 2026 with major AI-native improvements and enhanced GitHub Copilot integration

title: OpenAI Acquisition Finalized
description: OpenAI completes $3 billion acquisition of Windsurf, marking the company's largest acquisition to date and signaling major ambitions in AI coding tools

title: Google Poaches Windsurf Team
description: Google acquires Windsurf executives and team for $2.4B, disrupting OpenAI's acquisition plans and intensifying AI coding competition

title: Devin 2.0 Massive Price Reduction
description: Cognition slashes Devin AI software engineer pricing from $500 to $20 per month, making autonomous AI coding more accessible

title: Goldman Sachs Deploys Devin
description: Goldman Sachs adds AI engineer Devin to its development teams, marking a major enterprise adoption milestone for autonomous AI coding agents

title: Developer Walkthrough Published
description: The New Stack publishes comprehensive developer walkthrough of Aider, highlighting its open-source agentic CLI capabilities for AI-assisted coding

title: Custom AI Coding Assistants Platform
description: Continue launches platform to help developers create and share custom AI coding assistants, expanding customization options for teams
